title: Asian American Theatre
description: This course examines pivotal dramatic works in the history of professional Asian American theatre in the United States (1960s to the present). Issues include interculturalism, the crossover between minority theatres and mainstream venues, and the performance of identity. TDHT 103 is an approved Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) course. No prior knowledge in theatre history is needed. Prerequisites: upper-division standing or consent of instructor.
